intro: Herniaria payco, commonly known as coastal bladderwort, is a small, mat-forming plant native to coastal regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Herniaria payco is adapted to salt spray and is an important component of coastal ecosystems.
